result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler David Troutman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation no later than 12:00 p.m. on September 8, 2016.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined and paid through DOC.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM391.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM391.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Michael Hecky, Hudson Fleet Farm or Hudson Freedom.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time.
Defendant may serve 15 days from November 1 through the 15th, 2016 and the remaining 15 days to be served November 1 through the 15th, 2017.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler David Troutman

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF557, 15CM391 and 15CM625:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Tyler David Troutman appeared. Case called at 3:05 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Atty Caton recites agreement. ADA McKinley in agreement. State has complied with Victims Rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1 in 15CF557. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1 in 15CM391. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1 and Ct. 5 in 15CM625. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. Identity Theft in 15CF557 and court will withhold entry of judgment for a period of 3 years per the deferred agreement. Court finds the DE guilty of Ct. 1 Retail Theft in 15CM391. Court finds the DE guilty of Ct.1 Theft Movable Property and Ct. 5 Misd. Bail Jumping in 15CM625. On motion of the State without objecton, Ct's 2,3,4,6,7 & 8 in 15CM625 are dismissed and read in for restitution purposes and Ct's 2-10 in 15CF557 dismissed and read in for restitution purposes. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. State has 30 days to provide restitution worksheet

Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF557:

- 3 year deferred agreement

Ct. 1 in 15CM391:

- S/W 2 years probation. Report to Probation no later than noon on 09-08-2016

- 30 days conditional jail time. May serve 15 days from Nov.1 - 15, 2016 and the remaining 15 days Nov.1 - 15, 2017

- 100 hours C.S.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michael Hecky, Hudson Fleet Farm and Hudson Freedom.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00.

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. To be paid over the course of probation. 

- Restitution. Amount to be determined.

Ct. 1 in 15CM625:

- S/W 2 years probation. Report to Probation no later than noon on 09-08-2016. TO RUN CONCURRENT TO 15CM391.

- 30 days conditional jail time. May serve 15 days from Nov.1 - 15, 2016 and the remaining 15 days Nov.1 - 15, 2017

- 100 hours C.S.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michael Hecky, Hudson Fleet Farm and Hudson Freedom.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00.

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. To be paid over the course of probation. 

- Restitution. Amount to be determined.

Ct. 5 in 15CM625: 

- - S/W 2 years probation. Report to Probation no later than noon on 09-08-2016. TO RUN CONCURRENT TO 15CM391 and CT. 1 IN 15CM625.

- 30 days conditional jail time. May serve 15 days from Nov.1 - 15, 2016 and the remaining 15 days Nov.1 - 15, 2017

- 100 hours C.S.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00.

Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Caton
Pre-trial conference at 09-14-2015 11:45 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Fleet Farm in Hudson, Wi.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
